reviews.text: Unlicensed barber shops. Men in suits whispering behind your back.
Speakers don't work properly and the station is a bit dirty.

It's a station that has no wheel chair access. 
Been there for a long time and shows its age.
Wet windy days are no fun ,especially as recently there have been many delays and cancelled trains.
Convenient for train to Moor gate.

Trains here are fairly frequent giving services to Moorgate, Welwyn, Hertford and Letchworth. The station is located nearby from the emirates stadium however the station lacks ticket barriers, step free access or any other modern facilities bar a ticket machine. The station is usually closed during events to prevent overcrowding.

Drayton Park railway station is a National Rail station in Highbury, in the London Borough of Islington. It is on the Northern City Line between Highbury & Islington and Finsbury Park stations; it is in Travelcard Zone 2
